headline: Samoa Lifts State of Emergency After Deadly Measles Epidemic
abstract: The Pacific island nation will reopen schools after a measles outbreak killed 81 people, many of them children.

headline: Goar Vartanyan, Celebrated Soviet Spy, Dies at 93
abstract: Without her and her husband, also a Soviet spy, “the history of our world could have been different,” the Kremlin said. But her exact role remains a secret.

headline: Lawmakers Push JPMorgan Chief on How He Will Deal With Racism
abstract: Five senators and two members of the House of Representatives asked Jamie Dimon to list the bank’s run-ins with authorities over discrimination and explain how it plans to do better.

headline: 2 Dead in Protests Over India’s Religion-Based Citizenship Bill
abstract: Demonstrators defied troops and a curfew after the bill, which would make it easier for some non-Muslim migrants to become citizens, was approved in Parliament.

headline: A Brexit Logjam, in Three Dimensions
abstract: Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the Labour Party and the European Union are all waiting for the other to make the next move. Meanwhile, Britons seethe.

headline: ‘Survivor’ Limps to a Finale After a Difficult Season
abstract: Kellee Kim, a contestant who raised concerns about inappropriate touching, agreed to take part in the final episode only after she got a guarantee from CBS that she would be able to speak freely.

headline: Can PG&E Survive the California Wildfires?
abstract: Hedge funds, fire victims and public officials all have a stake in what becomes of the giant utility, now in bankruptcy. And Warren Buffett’s name is being invoked.

headline: SALT Tax Increase That Burned Blue States is Targeted by Democrats
abstract: The House of Representatives voted to repeal the cap on a popular tax break, but the effort will die in the Senate.
